ns0:Resource.title: WISE (Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer)

curation.publisher: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

content.subject: WISE all-sky infrared
content.description: NASA's Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE; Wright et al. 2010) mapped the sky at 3.4, 4.6, 12, and 22 Î¼m (W1, W2, W3, W4) in 2010 with an angular resolution of 6.1", 6.4", 6.5", & 12.0" in the four bands. WISE achieved 5Ï point source sensitivities better than 0.08, 0.11, 1 and 6 mJy in unconfused regions on the ecliptic in the four bands. Sensitivity improves toward the ecliptic poles due to denser coverage and lower zodiacal background.

parameterDefinition.name: Query
parameterDefinition.description: Astronomy Data Query Language that defines the search criteria

parameterDefinition.name: RA column name
parameterDefinition.description: Name for input Right-Ascension column (or expression): column data in degrees

parameterDefinition.name: DEC column name
parameterDefinition.description: Name for input Declination column (or expression): column data in degrees

parameterDefinition.name: Find Mode
parameterDefinition.description: Find mode for matches: BEST or ALL

parameterDefinition.name: Input VOTable
parameterDefinition.description: Input VOTable, containing Right Ascension and Declination columns, for matching against
